title: VPN Guide - Anonymity and Privacy
description: Learn how Virtual Private Networks protect your identity online

sections.heading: What is a VPN?
sections.content: A Virtual Private Network (VPN) creates an encrypted tunnel between your device and a remote server. Your internet traffic is routed through this tunnel, hiding your real IP address and location.

sections.heading: Why Use a VPN?
benefits: Hide your IP address and location

sections.heading: How VPNs Work
sections.content:
When you connect to a VPN:

1. Your device establishes an encrypted connection to a VPN server
2. All your internet traffic is routed through this server
3. Websites see the VPN server's IP, not yours
4. Your ISP can't see what websites you visit
5. Your data is protected from eavesdropping

commands.description: Connect to a VPN server for anonymity
Disconnect from VPN and use your real IP

sections.heading: When to Use VPN in Missions
sections.content:
Always connect to VPN before:

✓ Scanning networks
✓ Testing security vulnerabilities
✓ Accessing sensitive systems
✓ Any reconnaissance activities

This protects your identity and follows ethical hacking best practices.

sections.heading: VPN Limitations
sections.content:
VPNs are not perfect:

• VPN providers can see your traffic
• Some websites block VPN connections
• VPNs don't protect against malware
• Your behavior can still identify you
• Logging policies vary by provider

For maximum anonymity, combine VPN with TOR and other privacy tools.

sections.heading: Real-World VPN Tips
tips: Use VPNs in countries with strong privacy laws
Always use VPN on public WiFi
Don't trust free VPNs with sensitive data
